property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor listens for UDP (datagram) messages on the specified host interface and port. If the value of the port input is initially negative, then this accessor waits until it receives a non-negative port input before initiating listening. Otherwise, it begins listening during initialization. If at any time during execution it receives a port input, then it will close any open socket and, if the new port value is non-negative, open a new socket to the current host and port.

When the connection is established, a true boolean is sent to the listening output. If the connection is broken during execution, then a false boolean is sent to the listening output. The swarmlet could respond to this by retrying to connect (send an event to the port input).

The receive type can be any of those supported by the host. The list of supported types will be provided as options for the and receiveType parameter. For the Ptolemy II host, these include at least 'string', 'number', 'image', and a variety of numeric types.

Note that UDP, unlike TCP, has the notion of a "message" (a datagram). A message can contain more than one byte. The receiveType determines the type of the elements of the output of this accessor.

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim and Edward A. Lee, Contributor: Christopher Brooks

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: message (port)
property.value: The received message as a raw byte array.

property.name: listening (port)
property.value: True to indicate that listening has begun, false to indicate that it has stopped.

property.name: listeningAddress (port)
property.value: The interface to listen on for incoming messages. This defaults to "0.0.0.0", which means to listen on all network interfaces.

property.name: listeningPort (port)
property.value: The port to listen on for incoming messages. This defaults to 8084.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor sends UDP (datagram) messages to the specified destination address and port.

The send type can be any of those supported by the host. The list of supported types will be provided as options for the sendType parameter. For the Ptolemy II host, these include at least 'string', 'number', 'image', and a variety of numeric types.

Note that UDP, unlike TCP, has the notion of a "message" (a datagram). A message can contain more than one byte. The receiveType determines the type of the elements sent by this accessor

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim and Edward A. Lee, Contributor: Christopher Brooks

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: toSend (port)
property.value: The message to send.

property.name: destinationAddress (port)
property.value: The host name or IP address to send to. This defaults to "localhost".

property.name: destinationPort (port)
property.value: The port to send to. This defaults to 8084.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: script
